model.interfaces.components.entities

Interface Manifest

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssetManifest, AtomManifest, BasicManifest, CompoundManifest

    public interface Manifest
    A manifest is an entity that describes assets, compounds and atoms by recording metadata about them.

    A manifest is not updatable.
    Manifests are publishable within the sea of stuff and allow discoverability of assets, compounds and atoms.
    Manifests are represented as a set of labels and values.

    This interface defines the common schema to be used by the manifests that live in the manifest space of the Sea of Stuff.
    Author:
    Simone I. Conte "sic2@st-andrews.ac.uk"

    • Method Detail

      • getGUID

        GUID getGUID()
        The GUID of this manifest. This GUID is generated by hashing the content of the manifest.
        Returns:
        the GUID of this manifest.

      • getManifestType

        java.lang.String getManifestType()
        Get a string representation for the type of manifest.
        Returns:

      • getSignature

        Signature getSignature()
        Get the signature used for this manifest.
        Returns:
        the signature used for this manifest. Null if the manifest is not signed.

      • getTimestamp

        long getTimestamp()
        Get the timestamp of this manifest.
        Returns:
        the timestamp of this manifest.s

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Check that the key-value pairs contained in the manifest comply to the Sea of Stuff standard and are not malformed. All required key-value pairs must be set in the manifest, for the latter to be valid.
        Returns:
        true if the manifest is valid.

      • toJSON

        java.lang.String toJSON()
        FIXME Note that any java object inherits from Object and thus implements the method Object.toString(). However, it is good design that classes implementing Manifest DO implement this method.
        Returns:
        string representation of this manifest.

      • verify

        boolean verify()
        Verify this manifest's GUID against its content. SeaOfStuff.verifyManifest(Manifest)
        Returns:
